snippet: The Kyoto court ordered the far-right Zaitokukai group to pay $120,000 for staging demonstrations characterized as racist, usually against Koreans and Chinese, at an ethnic Korean school.
abstract: Kyoto court orders Zaitokukai, far-right group, to pay $120,000 in damages to an elementary school for ethnic Koreans after the group staged demonstrations using slogans that the court characterized as racist; ruling is one of the first in Japan to address proliferation of street protests using hate speech against ethnic minorities, usually Koreans and Chinese.
lead_paragraph: The Kyoto court ordered the far-right Zaitokukai group to pay $120,000 for staging demonstrations characterized as racist, usually against Koreans and Chinese, at an ethnic Korean school.

headline.main: Japanese Court Fines Rightist Group Over Protests at a School in Kyoto
headline.print_headline: Japanese Court Fines Rightist Group Over Protests at a School in Kyoto
